 To apply for admission into the South African Nursing Council SANC Application Form 2024, kindly follow the link and apply online. All applications must be submitted online

What Does SANC Mean?

The SANC is the regulatory body for nurses and midwives in South Africa, and it is responsible for ensuring that all nurses and midwives meet certain standards of education and practice before they are allowed to work in the profession. To register with the SANC, applicants must complete an application form and meet the council’s requirements for education, training, and professional conduct.

SANC Application Form

You can find the SANC Application Form on the SANC website, along with instructions for completing the form and information about the registration process. If you are interested in becoming a nurse or midwife in South Africa, I would suggest visiting the SANC website for more information.

What to Know About the South African Nursing Council Application Form Portal

The South African Nursing Council SANC Application portal is designed to accept application of candidates seeking for admission into the University. In the portal, applicant can Purchase application form, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slip, check admission list, etc.

What do you need to register with SANC?

A certified copy of your identity document or passport (the details of which are reflected in this application) and your school leaving certificate must be submitted together with this application.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission in the SANC application portal, candidates must;

  • Have Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to SANC on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%

How to Apply | SANC Application Form 2024

Eligible candidates can click here to apply.

Follow the steps below

  • Visit Application portal
  • Choose type of Application (Undergraduate, Post Graduate, Semester Studies)
  • Fill and complete all necessary pages
  • Pay Application fees where required

South African Nursing Council Application Required Documents

To apply to SANC you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript

How Much is SANC Application Fees

The cost of the SANC application fee varies depending on the type of application you are submitting. As of my knowledge cutoff date of September 2024, the SANC fees were as follows:
  • New registration as a nurse or midwife: R640 (South African Rand)
  • Annual renewal of registration as a nurse or midwife: R560
  • Reinstatement of registration: R900
  • Restoration of a name to the register: R360
  • Verification of registration status: R180

Please note that these fees are subject to change and may have been updated since my knowledge cutoff date. Additionally, if you are applying from outside of South Africa, you may need to pay an additional fee for international bank transfer charges.

  • Church of Scotland Hospital School Nursing Training Form 2024

How To Check if you are Registered to SANC?

The SANC has made an eRegister facility available on the SANC website which can be utilised by employers to verify the registration status of all Nurse Practitioners in their employment. Employers are urged to utilise this facility in the absence of a physical Annual Practising Certificate (APC).

Lists of SANC Accredited Nursing Schools 2024

The lists of Accredited Nursing Education Institutions are published here for your information:

  • PRIVATE Nursing Education Institutions (by Province) accredited to offer the NEW qualifications
  • PUBLIC Nursing Colleges (by Province) accredited to offer the NEW qualifications
  • Universities (by Province) accredited to offer the NEW qualifications
  • Accredited PRIVATE Nursing Education Institutions (by Province) still offering legacy qualifications
  • Accredited PUBLIC Nursing Education Institutions (by Province) still offering legacy qualifications

SANC Account Number

To make payment through Bank, the SANC Account Number below is provided for ease of payment.

Council Bank Details:
Bank Name: First National Bank
Branch Code: 253145
Account Name: S A Nursing Council No 2 Account
Account Number: 514 211 86 193

SANC Annual Fees for 2024

1.1 NORMAL ANNUAL FEES

The annual fees for the calendar year 2024 for different categories of practitioners are provided in the table below:

CATEGORY ANNUAL FEE FOR 2024
Registered Nurses and Midwives R700.00
Enrolled Nurses and Midwives R418.00
Enrolled Nursing Auxiliaries R293.00

1.2 REDUCTIONS IN ANNUAL FEES FOR AGE 60 AND OVER

The Council has resolved to introduce reduced fees for nurses 60 years of age and over as per the table below:

1.2.1 60 TO 64 YEARS OF AGE ON 1 JANUARY 2024 (25% REDUCTION)

CATEGORY ANNUAL FEE FOR 2024
Registered Nurses and Midwives R525.00
Enrolled Nurses and Midwives R314.00
Enrolled Nursing Auxiliaries R220.00

1.2.2 65 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER ON 01 JANUARY 2024 (50% REDUCTION)

CATEGORY ANNUAL FEE FOR 2024
Registered Nurses and Midwives R350.00
Enrolled Nurses and Midwives R209.00
Enrolled Nursing Auxiliaries R157.00

How long does it take SANC to register?

A. After completion documents have reached the council, registration can take anything from one month to a couple. Once you have confirmed that completion documents are with the council, follow up, using the parcel’s tracking/waybill number, with the Registrations Dept on 012 426 9599/jnxumalo@sanc.co.za.

How Do I Pay SANC Fees Online?

Fill in and sign an Account Deposit Slip. Use the Council’s bank details shown below. Write your Council reference number (8-digit number starting with a ‘1’) in the Reference block on the form followed immediately (no space) by the annual fees payment code ‘ANLFEES’

For more information regarding the application for admission into the South African Nursing Council, kindly drop your messages in the comment box below.

FAQ About SANC Application Form

Here are some frequently asked questions about the SANC application form:

Q: What is the SANC Application Form?

A: The SANC Application Form is a form that must be completed by nurses and midwives who wish to register with the South African Nursing Council. It contains information about the applicant’s education, training, and professional history, and is used to assess whether the applicant meets the council’s requirements for registration.

Q: Where can I find the SANC Application Form?

A: You can find the SANC Application Form on the SANC website or by contacting the council directly.

Q: What documents do I need to submit with my SANC Application Form?

A: The documents required for the SANC Application Form vary depending on the type of application you are submitting. However, generally, you will need to submit proof of your identity, your qualifications, and your work experience.

Q: How much does the SANC Application Form cost?

A: The cost of the SANC Application Form varies depending on the type of application you are submitting. Please see my previous response for more information.

Q: How long does it take to process the SANC Application Form?

A: The processing time for the SANC Application Form can vary depending on the complexity of the application and the volume of applications being processed. However, generally, it can take several weeks to several months for the council to review and approve an application.

Q: What happens if my SANC Application Form is rejected?

A: If your SANC Application Form is rejected, the council will provide you with feedback on why your application was not approved. You may then have the opportunity to submit additional documentation or make changes to your application before resubmitting it for review.
